title: Denmark
excerpt: A Nordic country in Northern Europe
text: Denmark is a Nordic country in Northern Europe consisting of the Jutland Peninsula and numerous islands. Copenhagen, the capital, is the largest city and is located on the eastern coast of Zealand. Denmark has a population of about 5.9 million and is known for its flat landscape, strong winds, and extensive coastline. The country is famous for its design, wind energy, and bicycle culture. Denmark is part of the Nordic countries and joined the European Union in 1973. The Little Mermaid statue in Copenhagen is a famous symbol of the city. Denmark has a strong welfare system and consistently ranks high in quality of life indices.
